title: It Ends With Us
author: Colleen Hoover
description: A poignant love story that explores the complexities of relationships and domestic abuse, following Lily as she navigates her feelings for two different men.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: A coming-of-age story and a murder mystery set in the marshes of North Carolina, following Kya as she becomes a prime suspect in a local man's death.

title: Little Fires Everywhere
author: Celeste Ng
description: Set in a seemingly perfect suburb, the story delves into the lives of two families and explores themes of class, race, and motherhood, culminating in a dramatic fire.

title: Normal People
author: Sally Rooney
description: A novel exploring the complicated relationship between Marianne and Connell through their adolescence and university years, tackling themes of love, class and communication.

title: The Nightingale
author: Kristin Hannah
description: A powerful story of two sisters in Nazi-occupied France, highlighting their struggles, bravery, and different ways of resisting during World War II.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: Narrated by Death, the story follows a young girl in Nazi Germany who finds solace and strength through stolen books, portraying the harsh realities of war.

title: Tenth of December
author: George Saunders
description: A collection of sharp, funny and deeply moving short stories, exploring the lives of ordinary individuals and pushing the boundaries of the genre.

title: The Lottery and Other Stories
author: Shirley Jackson
description: A collection of haunting and unsettling short stories that examine the dark side of human nature, including the iconic and disturbing title story.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A beloved classic exploring the social mores and romantic entanglements of the Bennet sisters in 19th century England, with wit and sharp social commentary.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A timeless coming-of-age story told from the perspective of a young girl, set in the American South, addressing issues of race and prejudice.

title: The Empathy Exams
author: Leslie Jamison
description: A collection of deeply personal and insightful essays exploring the limits of empathy and the complex ways we connect with others.

title: Consider the Lobster
author: David Foster Wallace
description: A collection of insightful and witty essays on a variety of topics, showcasing Wallace's unique voice and exploration of American culture.

title: I'll Be Gone in the Dark
author: Michelle McNamara
description: A gripping true crime narrative that follows McNamara's investigation into the Golden State Killer and her dedication to bringing him to justice.

title: In Cold Blood
author: Truman Capote
description: A groundbreaking true crime novel that reconstructs the brutal murder of a Kansas family and explores the psyche of their killers.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A powerful memoir about Westover's journey from being raised in a survivalist family to earning a PhD from Cambridge University.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A sweeping narrative that traces the history of humankind, from ancient times to the present, exploring the forces that have shaped our species.

title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
author: Stephen Covey
description: A self-help classic that presents a principle-centered approach to personal and interpersonal effectiveness, with practical advice for achieving success and happiness.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: A practical guide to building good habits and breaking bad ones, using science-backed strategies and techniques for personal growth.

title: A Brief History of Time
author: Stephen Hawking
description: A popular science book that explores the origins of the universe, black holes, and the nature of time, making complex ideas accessible to a wide audience.

title: Cosmos
author: Carl Sagan
description: A beautifully written exploration of the universe, from its origins to its future, combining science and philosophy to inspire wonder and curiosity.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: An epic science fiction novel set in a far-future feudal interstellar society, exploring complex themes of politics, religion, and ecology on the desert planet Arrakis.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: A thrilling science fiction novel about an astronaut stranded on Mars and his struggle to survive, using his ingenuity and science to overcome challenges.

title: Neuromancer
author: William Gibson
description: A groundbreaking cyberpunk novel that explores the intersection of virtual reality, artificial intelligence, and corporate power, introducing a dystopian future of hacking and high-tech crime.

title: Snow Crash
author: Neal Stephenson
description: A fast-paced cyberpunk novel that combines virtual reality, linguistics, ancient mythology, and conspiracy theories in a complex and thrilling narrative.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A classic fantasy adventure that follows Bilbo Baggins on his quest to reclaim a stolen treasure, featuring a rich world, memorable characters, and thrilling encounters.

title: A Game of Thrones
author: George R.R. Martin
description: The first book in the epic 'A Song of Ice and Fire' series, this high fantasy novel delves into a complex world of political intrigue, war, and mythical creatures.

title: Neverwhere
author: Neil Gaiman
description: A captivating urban fantasy novel that follows a man who falls into a hidden world beneath London, filled with magic, myth, and strange creatures.

title: Rivers of London
author: Ben Aaronovitch
description: An exciting urban fantasy novel where a young police officer discovers that magic is real and becomes a detective solving supernatural crimes in London.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society, exploring themes of surveillance, propaganda, and the loss of individual freedom.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: A thrilling dystopian young adult novel set in a post-apocalyptic world where children are forced to compete in a televised battle for survival.

title: The Thursday Murder Club
author: Richard Osman
description: A lighthearted and charming cozy mystery about a group of elderly friends in a retirement village who meet to discuss old murder cases and become involved in solving a new one.

title: A Killer's Cookbook
author: Penny Pike
description: A cozy mystery set in a small town where a food blogger has to solve a series of murders while also discovering new recipes

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A dark and gripping crime novel that follows a journalist and a mysterious hacker as they investigate a decades-old disappearance, uncovering a world of secrets and violence.

title: The Godfather
author: Mario Puzo
description: An iconic crime novel that tells the story of the Corleone family and their complex web of power, loyalty, and betrayal in the world of organized crime.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A suspenseful thriller that follows the twists and turns of a marriage gone wrong, as the husband becomes a prime suspect in his wife's disappearance.

title: The Girl on the Train
author: Paula Hawkins
description: A psychological thriller told from multiple perspectives, following the story of a woman who becomes entangled in a missing person investigation.

title: The Firm
author: John Grisham
description: A gripping legal thriller that follows a young lawyer who discovers that his prestigious law firm is involved in shady dealings, putting him in grave danger.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A gripping psychological thriller that follows a psychotherapist as he attempts to unravel the mystery behind a famous artist who has gone silent after killing her husband.

title: Rebecca
author: Daphne du Maurier
description: A classic gothic novel and psychological thriller, exploring themes of jealousy, identity and the lingering presence of the past in the life of a young woman.

title: Red, White & Royal Blue
author: Casey McQuiston
description: A charming and heartwarming contemporary romance about the son of the US President and a British prince who fall in love despite their royal obligations.

title: People We Meet on Vacation
author: Emily Henry
description: A sweet and engaging contemporary romance about two best friends who take annual vacations together and navigate their complicated feelings for each other.

title: The Duke and I
author: Julia Quinn
description: The first book in the beloved Bridgerton series, a historical romance set in Regency-era England, filled with love, family drama, and societal expectations.

title: Outlander
author: Diana Gabaldon
description: A captivating historical romance with elements of time travel, following the story of a World War II nurse who is transported back to 18th century Scotland, where she falls in love with a Highlander.

title: A Court of Thorns and Roses
author: Sarah J. Maas
description: A popular fantasy romance novel with strong enemies-to-lovers vibes, following a human woman who becomes entangled in the affairs of faeries.

title: From Blood and Ash
author: Jennifer L. Armentrout
description: An enthralling fantasy romance with a focus on forbidden love between a maiden and a mysterious guard, filled with magic, action, and complex characters.

title: The Hating Game
author: Sally Thorne
description: A witty and hilarious romantic comedy about two office rivals who find themselves falling for each other, despite their constant bickering and competitive nature.

title: Get a Life, Chloe Brown
author: Talia Hibbert
description: A fun and feel-good romantic comedy following a chronically ill woman who decides to create a 'get a life' list, leading her to new experiences and a charming love interest.

title: Fifty Shades of Grey
author: E.L. James
description: A highly popular erotic romance that follows the intense and passionate relationship between a college graduate and a mysterious billionaire, exploring themes of power, dominance, and submission.

title: Bared to You
author: Sylvia Day
description: The first book in the 'Crossfire' series, an erotic romance that depicts the intense and often tumultuous relationship between two people with dark pasts and strong desires.

title: The Very Hungry Caterpillar
author: Eric Carle
description: A classic picture book about a caterpillar who eats his way through a variety of foods before transforming into a beautiful butterfly, using vibrant illustrations and a simple narrative.

title: Where the Wild Things Are
author: Maurice Sendak
description: A timeless picture book about a boy who sails away to a land of wild creatures, exploring themes of imagination, anger and adventure through iconic illustrations

title: Frog and Toad Are Friends
author: Arnold Lobel
description: A gentle collection of short stories about the friendship between two lovable characters, Frog and Toad, perfect for beginning readers.

title: Fly Guy Presents: Sharks
author: Tedd Arnold
description: A fun and engaging early reader book that combines facts about sharks with a humorous narrative that is perfect for young learners.

title: Wonder
author: R.J. Palacio
description: A heartwarming and inspiring middle-grade novel about a boy with facial differences who enters mainstream school for the first time, teaching valuable lessons about empathy and acceptance.

title: The Lightning Thief
author: Rick Riordan
description: The first book in the Percy Jackson series, a thrilling fantasy adventure that follows a young boy who discovers he's the son of Poseidon and gets involved in a world of Greek mythology.

title: Brain Quest Workbook: Grade 2
author: Workman Publishing
description: An educational activity book that reinforces school curriculum through a variety of interactive activities, perfect for children in second grade to learn and have fun.

title: Paint by Sticker: Animals
author: Workman Publishing
description: A fun and creative activity book that combines art and puzzles, allowing children to create beautiful sticker art by following numbered patterns.

title: Charlotte's Web
author: E.B. White
description: A beloved chapter book about the friendship between a pig and a spider, exploring themes of life, death, and the power of loyalty and compassion.

title: Matilda
author: Roald Dahl
description: A charming and fun chapter book about a gifted young girl with neglectful parents who discovers her magical abilities, showcasing her resilience and love for learning

title: The Diary of a Young Girl
author: Anne Frank
description: A powerful autobiography based on Anne Frank's diary, detailing her life and experience in hiding during World War II, offering a poignant and personal perspective on history.

title: Long Walk to Freedom
author: Nelson Mandela
description: The autobiography of Nelson Mandela, recounting his life, activism, and struggle against apartheid, providing a firsthand account of his unwavering commitment to justice.

title: Steve Jobs
author: Walter Isaacson
description: A comprehensive biography of Steve Jobs, co-founder of Apple, exploring his complex personality, business acumen, and revolutionary contributions to the tech industry.

title: Alexander Hamilton
author: Ron Chernow
description: An in-depth biography of Alexander Hamilton, one of the founding fathers of the United States, examining his pivotal role in shaping the nation.

title: Eat, Pray, Love
author: Elizabeth Gilbert
description: A popular memoir recounting Elizabeth Gilbert's journey of self-discovery after a divorce, as she travels through Italy, India, and Indonesia.

title: Wild
author: Cheryl Strayed
description: A powerful memoir following Cheryl Strayed's solo hike along the Pacific Crest Trail after experiencing personal tragedies, showcasing resilience and self-healing.

title: Letters to a Young Poet
author: Rainer Maria Rilke
description: A compilation of ten insightful letters written by Rainer Maria Rilke to a young poet, offering profound reflections on art, life, and the creative process.

title: The Journal of a Disappointed Man
author: W. N. P. Barbellion
description: A compelling journal revealing the inner life and struggles of a naturalist, Barbellion's experiences with illness, ambition and disappointments.

title: SPQR: A History of Ancient Rome
author: Mary Beard
description: A comprehensive and engaging history of ancient Rome, exploring its rise, culture, and lasting legacy, with insights into the political, social, and military aspects of the empire.

title: The Histories
author: Herodotus
description: A foundational text of Western history, this book offers an account of the Greco-Persian Wars, exploring a vast variety of cultures, stories and events of ancient civilizations.

title: Guns, Germs, and Steel
author: Jared Diamond
description: A groundbreaking book that explores the geographical and environmental factors contributing to the dominance of certain civilizations and their impact on world history.

title: A History of the World in 100 Objects
author: Neil MacGregor
description: A history of the world told through the stories and significance of 100 objects from the collection of the British Museum.

title: Team of Rivals
author: Doris Kearns Goodwin
description: A thorough account of Abraham Lincoln's presidency and his cabinet, examining how he strategically brought together his political rivals to steer the nation through the Civil War.

title: Bury My Heart at Wounded Knee
author: Dee Brown
description: A deeply moving historical account of the Native American experience during the expansion of the American West, written from the perspective of the indigenous peoples.

title: The Guns of August
author: Barbara W. Tuchman
description: A detailed analysis of the events leading up to World War I, focusing on the political and military decisions that shaped the early stages of the conflict.

title: Band of Brothers
author: Stephen E. Ambrose
description: A gripping military history that follows the experiences of Easy Company, 506th Regiment of the 101st Airborne Division, through their training and combat during World War II.

title: All the President's Men
author: Carl Bernstein and Bob Woodward
description: A firsthand account of the Watergate scandal by the two journalists who broke the story, revealing the political intrigue and cover-ups within the Nixon administration.

title: No Easy Day
author: Mark Owen
description: A gripping insider's account of the raid that killed Osama bin Laden, written by a Navy SEAL who was part of the operation.

title: The Elegant Universe
author: Brian Greene
description: A popular science book that explores the concepts of string theory and its potential to unify general relativity and quantum mechanics.

title: Seven Brief Lessons on Physics
author: Carlo Rovelli
description: A concise and accessible introduction to modern physics, covering key concepts such as relativity, quantum mechanics, and black holes.

title: The Disappearing Spoon
author: Sam Kean
description: A popular science book that explores the periodic table and the stories behind the elements, combining science with history, humor, and fascinating anecdotes.

title: Napoleon's Buttons
author: Penny Le Couteur
description: An engaging exploration of how 17 molecules have shaped key historical events, blending chemistry with history.

title: The Selfish Gene
author: Richard Dawkins
description: A groundbreaking book that explores the evolutionary theory from a gene-centric perspective, explaining the nature of selfishness and altruism in the animal kingdom.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A sweeping narrative that traces the history of humankind, from ancient times to the present, exploring the forces that have shaped our species.

title: Code Complete
author: Steve McConnell
description: A comprehensive and widely respected guide to software development, covering coding techniques, best practices, and advanced topics for experienced and beginner programmers.

title: The Innovators
author: Walter Isaacson
description: A comprehensive history of the computer and internet, exploring the stories of the people who transformed technology and had a dramatic impact on the world.

title: Structures
author: J.E. Gordon
description: A classic text that provides a fascinating explanation of structures in both the natural and built environment, for those interested in engineering and design.

title: To Engineer Is Human
author: Henry Petroski
description: A insightful examination of the history of engineering failures and the key role that failure plays in the progress of engineering and innovation.

title: Into the Wild
author: Jon Krakauer
description: A compelling account of the journey and fate of Christopher McCandless, who left behind his conventional life to seek adventure in the Alaskan wilderness.

title: Touching the Void
author: Joe Simpson
description: A thrilling and terrifying story of survival in the Andes, where two climbers face a life-or-death situation on a dangerous descent.

title: Lonely Planet's Best in Travel 2023
author: Lonely Planet
description: A popular and comprehensive travel guide featuring the top destinations, experiences, and trends in travel for the year 2023.

title: National Geographic Guide to National Parks
author: National Geographic
description: A detailed guide to the National Parks across the United States, featuring detailed maps, practical planning and guidance.

title: Eat, Pray, Love
author: Elizabeth Gilbert
description: A popular memoir recounting Elizabeth Gilbert's journey of self-discovery after a divorce, as she travels through Italy, India, and Indonesia.

title: Into Thin Air
author: Jon Krakauer
description: A gripping firsthand account of the disastrous 1996 Mount Everest disaster, exploring the challenges of high-altitude mountaineering and the human drama that unfolded.

title: National Geographic Complete Photography
author: Joel Sartore
description: A comprehensive guide to photography from National Geographic, covering techniques, composition and insights for aspiring and established photographers alike.

title: The Travel Photographer's Way
author: Nori Jemil
description: A helpful guide to improve your travel photography, offering practical advice, inspirational stories and tips on composition, techniques and workflow.

title: The Geography of Bliss
author: Eric Weiner
description: An intriguing travelogue exploring the idea of happiness through different cultures around the world, blending travel writing with cultural analysis.

title: Neither Here nor There
author: Bill Bryson
description: A hilarious travel memoir detailing Bryson's backpacking journey through Europe, exploring the quirks, differences, and humor found within different cultures.

title: The Bread Baker's Apprentice
author: Peter Reinhart
description: A comprehensive guide to bread baking, offering professional techniques, recipes and insights to master artisan bread making at home.

title: The Cake Bible
author: Rose Levy Beranbaum
description: An extensive guide to cake baking, with precise recipes and techniques for achieving excellent results, with focus on ingredients and the science behind baking.

title: Plenty
author: Yotam Ottolenghi
description: A popular vegetarian cookbook featuring inventive and flavorful recipes that showcase the diversity and richness of plant-based cuisine.

title: The Vegetarian Cookbook
author: DK
description: A comprehensive cookbook filled with a wide variety of vegetarian recipes from across different cuisines, catering to all levels of cooking.

title: Veganomicon
author: Isa Chandra Moskowitz and Terry Hope Romero
description: A comprehensive and innovative guide to vegan cooking, offering a wide variety of recipes and tips for creating flavorful plant-based dishes.

title: The Plant-Based Cookbook
author: DK
description: A well-illustrated guide to plant-based cuisine that offers over 200 recipes to suit different tastes, with lots of tips and guidance for beginners.

title: Jerusalem
author: Yotam Ottolenghi and Sami Tamimi
description: A celebration of Jerusalem's diverse culinary landscape, blending the flavors of Jewish and Arab cuisine with rich recipes and beautiful photography.

title: Mastering the Art of French Cooking
author: Julia Child
description: A classic French cookbook that has been helping home cooks master classic French techniques, filled with detailed recipes and explanations.

title: How Not to Die
author: Michael Greger, M.D.
description: A comprehensive guide to using nutrition and food to combat and prevent the leading causes of death, with detailed scientific backing and practical advice.

title: The Food Lab
author: J. Kenji Lpez-Alt
description: A scientific approach to cooking that explores the 'why' behind cooking methods, with detailed explanations and recipes for both beginners and experienced cooks.
